me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.reflection

Enum PrimitiveType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<PrimitiveType>
      • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.reflection.PrimitiveType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PrimitiveType>

    public enum PrimitiveType
extends java.lang.Enum<PrimitiveType>
    Represents all Java primitives. This class does not convert to and from primitives and wrappers. getPrimitiveForWrapper converts wrapper types to primitive types, and getWrapperForPrimitive converts primitive types to wrapper types.
    Author:
    Glen Husman

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PrimitiveType.DefaultValues
      Represents default values for primitive types as defined by the Java Language Specification.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BOOLEAN
      Represents a boolean.
      BYTE
      Represents a signed byte.
      CHARACTER
      Represents a character.
      DOUBLE
      Represents a double-precision floating-point value.
      FLOAT
      Represents a single-precision floating-point value.
      INTEGER
      Represents a signed integer.
      LONG
      Represents a long integer (signed).
      SHORT
      Represents a short integer (signed).
      VOID
      Represents void, which has no value.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static PrimitiveType[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (PrimitiveType c : PrimitiveType.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static PrimitiveType valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • getWrapper

        public java.lang.Class<?> getWrapper()
        Gets the Class object representing the wrapper class for this PrimitiveType.
        Returns:
        The wrapped type.

      • getPrimitive

        public java.lang.Class<?> getPrimitive()
        Gets the Class object representing the primitive keyword (the non-wrapped class) for this PrimitiveType.
        Returns:
        The unwrapped type.

      • getDefaultValue

        public java.lang.Object getDefaultValue()
        Returns the default value for this primitive. This method should only be used if the PrimitiveType is not known at compile time. If it is, the values in PrimitiveType.DefaultValues should be used in preference to this method.
        Returns:
        The default value for this primitive as an instance of the wrapper class (as the returned value is an Object).

      • getDefaultValue

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.Object getDefaultValue(boolean useWrapper)
        Deprecated. This method effectively ignores the parameter as the language runtime automatically boxes values to be of the wrapper type when returned as an Object. getDefaultValue() is preferred.
        Returns the default value for this primitive.
        Parameters:
        useWrapper - Whether to express the returned value as an instance of the wrapper class (true) or of the primitive class (false).
        Returns:
        The default value for this primitive.

      • isWrapper

        public static boolean isWrapper(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Determines if the specified type represents a primitive wrapper type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to check.
        Returns:
        true if and only if type represents a supported primitive wrapper type.

      • isPrimitive

        public static boolean isPrimitive(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Determines if the specified type represents a primitive type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to check.
        Returns:
        true if and only if type represents a supported primitive non-wrapper type.

      • getPrimitiveType

        public static PrimitiveType getPrimitiveType(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Gets a PrimitiveType instance that is represented by the specified class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The primitive type (which may be a wrapper or primitive class) for which to retrieve an enum value.
        Returns:
        The enum value representing the specified class, or null if not found.
